text:
I've just installed Apache 2.0.50 on an HP ZX6000 running Red Hat AS 
3.0 for IA-64.I've found that "configure --quiet" will not work. In other 
words, the "checking..." messages are always displayed regardless if I include 
this switch or not. This has been verified by Joe Orton from RedHat 
(jorton@redhat.com):

"Yup, it's a problem in how the recursive configure invocation is written in 
APR. Can you file a bug on this?"
creator: christian.bonilla@hp.com

text:
Two aspects of this are fixed by:

http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/apr/build/apr_common.m4?r1=1.60&r2=1.61

all the the "checking" messages are surpressed with this change applied, though
the output is not completely empty as desired.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
jorton@redhat.com
text: This is mostly fixed in APR 1.0.1, and isn't really worth backporting.
